panels.description: **Peak Threads Connected**  is number of peak number of connections MySQL had in the period of time
panels.title: Peak Threads Connected

panels.description: **Avg Threads Running** is the average number of Threads running over interval which can be indicative of sustained load
panels.title: Avg Threads Running

panels.description: **Peak Threads Running** is the peak number of threads considered "Running" by MySQL, not Sleeping or Waiting on Table level locks which can be indicative for workload spikes
panels.title: Peak Threads Running

panels.description:
**Aborted Clients** shows how many connections were aborted (the client disconnected improperly or was terminated).

**Aborted Connects** shows how many attempts to connect to the MySQL server failed. If the number of attempts from a host reaches the value of the [max_connect_errors](https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/server-system-variables.html#sysvar_max_connect_errors) system variable, the server blocks that host from further connections. To unblock the host, flush the host cache using `FLUSH HOSTS`.
panels.title: Aborted Connects (Attempts)

panels.description:
**Aborted Clients** shows how many connections were aborted (the client disconnected improperly or was terminated).

**Aborted Connects** shows how many attempts to connect to the MySQL server failed. If the number of attempts from a host reaches the value of the [max_connect_errors](https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/server-system-variables.html#sysvar_max_connect_errors) system variable, the server blocks that host from further connections. To unblock the host, flush the host cache using `FLUSH HOSTS`.
panels.title: Aborted Clients (Timeout)

panels.description: The number of transactions
panels.title: Transaction Binlog Cache (Memory Use)

panels.description: The number of transactions
panels.title: Transaction Binlog Cache (Disk Use)

panels.description:
The number of queries sent to the server by clients, *excluding those executed within stored programs*.

This variable does not count the following commands:
* ``COM_PING``
* ``COM_STATISTICS``
* ``COM_STMT_PREPARE``
* ``COM_STMT_CLOSE``
* ``COM_STMT_RESET``
panels.title: Questions

panels.description: Shows how many *slow queries* were executed by the server. A query is considered slow if it takes more time than the value of the [long_query_time](https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/server-system-variables.html#sysvar_long_query_time) system variable.
panels.title: Slow Queries

targets.expr:
sum by (instance)(rate(mysql_global_status_handlers_total{instance=~"$host", handler=~"read_rnd|read_rnd_next"}[$interval]))
or sum by (instance)(irate(mysql_global_status_handlers_total{instance=~"$host", handler=~"read_rnd|read_rnd_next"}[5m]))

panels.description:
Shows how many selects were done without indexes. Such operations can impact performance.

* **Select Scan** is how many queries caused full table scans, in which all the data in the table had to be read and either discarded or returned.

* **Select Range** is how many queries used a range scan, which means MySQL scanned all rows in a given range.

* **Select Full Join** is the number of joins that are not joined on an index, this is usually a huge performance hit.
panels.title: Select Type (Select Full Table Join)

panels.description:
Shows how many selects were done without indexes. Such operations can impact performance.

* **Select Scan** is how many queries caused full table scans, in which all the data in the table had to be read and either discarded or returned.

* **Select Range** is how many queries used a range scan, which means MySQL scanned all rows in a given range.

* **Select Full Join** is the number of joins that are not joined on an index, this is usually a huge performance hit.
panels.title: Select Type (Select Full Table Scan)

panels.description:
**Sort Rows** shows how many rows had to be sorted to return them in the correct order.

For sorts that could not use indexes, it is important to note the following:

* **Sort Scan** shows how many sorts caused a full table scan.

* **Sort Range** shows how many sorts used a range scan.
panels.title: Sort Type (Full Table Sort Scan)

panels.description:
**Sort Rows** shows how many rows had to be sorted to return them in the correct order.

For sorts that could not use indexes, it is important to note the following:

* **Sort Scan** shows how many sorts caused a full table scan.

* **Sort Range** shows how many sorts used a range scan.
panels.title: Sort Type (Sort Merge Passes)

panels.description:
Shows how many table locks MySQL server requested from the storage engine.

**Table Locks Immediate** shows the number of times that a request for a table lock could be granted immediately.

**Table Locks Waited** shows the number of times that a request for a table lock could not be granted immediately. If this metric is rising, you need to deal with lock contention:

* Optimize queries that require table locks.
* Split tables that require frequent locking or replicate them.
panels.title: Table Locks Immediate

panels.description:
Shows how many table locks MySQL server requested from the storage engine.

**Table Locks Immediate** shows the number of times that a request for a table lock could be granted immediately.

**Table Locks Waited** shows the number of times that a request for a table lock could not be granted immediately. If this metric is rising, you need to deal with lock contention:

* Optimize queries that require table locks.
* Split tables that require frequent locking or replicate them.
panels.title: Table Locks Waited
InnoDB Contention - RW Locks Spin Rounds
InnoDB Contention - RW Locks OS Waits

panels.description: This is the number of times, after a table is opened or closed, a cache instance has an unused entry and the size of the instance is larger than table_open_cache / table_open_cache_instances.
panels.title: Table Open Cache Misses due to Overflows

targets.expr:
clamp_max( sum(rate(node_cpu{instance=~"$host", mode=~"user|nice|system"}[$interval])) by (instance) * 100 / count_scalar(node_cpu{mode=~"user", instance=~"$host"})
or sum(irate(node_cpu{instance=~"$host", mode=~"user|nice|system"}[5m])) by (instance) * 100 / count_scalar(node_cpu{mode=~"user", instance=~"$host"}) ,100)

clamp_max( sum(rate(node_cpu{instance=~"$host", mode="iowait"}[$interval])) by (instance) * 100 / count_scalar(node_cpu{mode="iowait", instance=~"$host"})
or sum(irate(node_cpu{instance=~"$host", mode="iowait"}[5m])) by (instance) * 100 / count_scalar(node_cpu{mode="iowait", instance=~"$host"}) ,100)

panels.title: Processes blocked (waiting for I/O to complete)

panels.description:
Shows how much network traffic is generated by MySQL.

**Outbound** is traffic sent from the server.

**Inbound** is traffic received by the server.
panels.title: MySQL Inbound Traffic

panels.description:
Shows how much network traffic is generated by MySQL.

**Outbound** is traffic sent from the server.

**Inbound** is traffic received by the server.
panels.title: MySQL Outbound Traffic
